DOC.brief_summary: Veterans return combat deployment face interrelate challenge process combat experience transition back civilian life . Unfortunately , many veteran wait year decade seek help post-deployment problem , seek . This study seek determine whether Internet-Based Expressive Writing ( IB-EW ) , brief , low-cost , easily disseminate , resource-efficient intervention , reduce psychological symptom improve function among Operation Iraqi Freedom ( OIF ) Operation Enduring Freedom ( OEF ) veteran navigate transition , also attempt reduce barrier help-seeking . Expressive Writing , highly private , readily accessible , non-stigmatizing intervention , strong evidence-base civilian population , efficacy combat veteran test . This study therefore seek test efficacy Expressive Writing veteran population enhance accessibility deliver internet ( Internet-Based Expressive Writing ; IB-EW ) . This study comprise randomize control trial three condition : ( ) Internet-Based Expressive Writing , ( b ) Internet-Based Control Writing , ( c ) No Writing/Treatment As Usual , total 1152 OIF/OEF veteran randomize across group . Expressive Writing participant write feeling transition soldier civilian ; Control Writing participant write factually information need new veteran ; Treatment Usual participant complete assessment engage write assignment . Participants complete standardize self-report measure psychological symptom , psychosocial functioning , life satisfaction baseline ( Session 1 ) three month ( Session 6 ) six month ( Session 7 ) post-intervention . Participants write condition write 20 minute four consecutive day ( Sessions 2-5 ) follow completion baseline measure ( participant TAU condition complete Sessions 2-5 ) . The study also attempt identify individual difference characteristic related efficacy treatment , see may likely benefit treatment . Analyses primarily entail multivariate analysis variance . Power adequate detect even small effect .
DOC.brief_title: Military Civilian : Trial Intervention Promote Postdeployment Reintegration
DOC.criteria: Veteran current war Iraq Afghanistan At least little difficulty transition soldier civilian Access computer internet Provide valid contact information Available participate 40 minute per session Interested participation Understand procedures consent Note : participant recruit random selection target population Severe depression
